perturbation.original_text:
“Subscriber” means any individual who purchases mobile content programming and: (a) who actually pays the applicable Subscription Fee; and (b) does not
receive a refund of such Subscription Fee for any reason within thirty (30) days from the end of the payment period for which the Subscription Fee was paid. A
Subscriber remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement so long as such individual continues to pay the applicable Subscription Fee.
perturbation.changed_text: “Subscriber” means any individual who accesses mobile content programming and: (a) who is billed for the applicable Subscription Fee; and (b) may receive a refund of such Subscription Fee at distributor's discretion. A Subscriber remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement until the termination of their access regardless of payment status.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Subscriber' hinges on *actual payment* and *no refund* within a specific timeframe. The modified definition changes this to 'billed' rather than paid, making refund discretionary and continuing of access, potentially conflicting with revenue-sharing agreements and creating uncertainty in calculating royalties due to IMNTV. This alteration introduces a contradiction by disconnecting subscriber status from actual payment.

perturbation.original_text:
“Programming”means IMNTV’s Content, as specifically described on Section B (1) of the Agreement. As used herein, “Programming” also includes any
promotional and marketing Content provided by Provider for IMNTV’s promotional and marketing activities as described herein.
perturbation.changed_text: “Programming”means selected content chosen at distributor discretion, regardless of provider's content, as generally described across various sections of this agreement. "Programming" will exclude provider's promotional content without explicit consent of all parties, which may be negotiated separately.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition tightly links 'Programming' to IMNTV's content. The modified definition broadens it to any content selected by the distributor, potentially undermining IMNTV's control over its brand and revenue generation. Furthermore, excluding promotional content from the term "programming" introduces financial ambiguity as it implies promotional content is not to be paid for under the revenue sharing agreement, however it also states it 'may be negotiated separately'. This contradiction would allow the distributor to freely use provided content as promotional, without needing to pay for it.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Copyright Law, Contract Law (specifically regarding control over licensed content)

perturbation.original_text:
6.1 Mobile Product Payments. Subscription fee in Territory is to be determined based on market research performed by Distributor with pricing to be agreed upon
jointly and in writing Each quarter, Distributor will make royalty payments to IMNTV based on a Structure as follows:
55% of subscriber revenue for the subscription based services broadcasting IMNTV content only, net of telecom percentage provided in accordance with this
Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Mobile Product Payments. Subscription fee in Territory is to be determined based on distributor's internal assessment, which will be shared with provider. Each year, distributor will remit payments to IMNTV based on distributor's discretion, with respect to the total subscription revenue, less operating costs and other associated fees.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes clear rules for revenue sharing (55% of subscriber revenue, net of telecom percentage). The altered text introduces ambiguity by giving the distributor sole discretion over royalty payments, after deducting operating costs, other associated fees. Because distributor's fees are not clearly defined and subject to market standard practices, the exact amount paid to IMNTV will be unknown, causing uncertainty in enforcement and making royalty calculations unverifiable and subject to manipulation, thus contradicting the initially agreed terms of payment.
